What is the function of the hair cells in a squid's body?

options.label: B
options.text: To detect the direction of water flow

options.label: C
options.text: To blend in with the surroundings

multiple-choice.question: What is the purpose of the countershading in a squid's body?

options.label: A
options.text: To eliminate a silhouette that a predator might spy from below

options.label: B
options.text: To detect the direction of water flow

options.label: C
options.text: To blend in with the surroundings

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the phantom form created by squid when they eject ink?
What is the speed at which squid can rapidly shoot away from their hunters using jet propulsion?
What is the name of the deep-sea squid that uses its webbed arms to make a cape when startled?
What is the name of the tiny squid that tosses sand over its body as it burrows away from prying eyes?
How long have squid been able to proliferate?

title: What makes you special?

multiple-choice.question: Where did Mariana grow up?
What was the purpose of Mariana's parents sending her and her sister to summer camp in the United States?
What phrase did Mariana's dad tell her when he sent her to summer camp in Brainerd, Minnesota?

options.label: C
options.text: "You never know what the future holds."

multiple-choice.question: What was the result of Mariana's experience at summer camp, and how did it affect her?

options.label: A
options.text: She became homesick and never made any friends.

options.label: B
options.text: She realized that being different is okay and that she could make friends despite her differences.

options.label: C
options.text: She became fluent in English but struggled to make friends.

options.label: D
options.text: She developed a strong sense of self and learned to appreciate her cultural background.

multiple-choice.question: What was the main reason Mariana initially struggled to accept her roommate, Fatima?

options.label: A
options.text: Fatima was shy and didn't know how to make friends.

options.label: B
options.text: Fatima was Muslim and wore a headscarf, which made her stand out.

options.label: C
options.text: Fatima was from a different country and didn't speak English fluently.

options.label: D
options.text: Fatima was not interested in participating in school activities.

multiple-choice.question: What was the talent that Mariana auctioned off in the school talent show?
What did Mariana realize about herself and others after her experiences at summer camp and in high school?

options.label: A
options.text: That everyone is the same and has the same interests.

options.label: B
options.text: That being different is okay and that everyone has something special to offer.

options.label: C
options.text: That people from different cultures are inferior to her.

options.label: D
options.text: That she is better than others because of her cultural background.

multiple-choice.question: What was the traumatic event that affected Mariana's sister and their family?

options.label: A
options.text: A car accident that left her sister with physical disabilities.

options.label: B
options.text: A fire that destroyed their home.

options.label: D
options.text: A serious illness that affected their sister.

multiple-choice.question: What did Mariana learn from her sister's experience?

options.label: A
options.text: That people with enough effort, people can overcome their physical disabilities.

options.label: B
options.text: That people with physical disabilities are inferior to be ashamed of.

options.label: C
options.text: That you can't let differences define you and that you can reimagine yourself beyond what others see.

options.label: D
options.text: That people with physical disabilities are a burden to society.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main message that Mariana wants to convey to her audience?

options.label: A
options.text: That everyone is the same and has the same interests.

options.label: B
options.text: That being different is something to be ashamed of.

options.label: C
options.text: That being human and embracing our differences is what makes us special and unique.

options.label: D
options.text: That people from different cultures are inferior to her.

multiple-choice.question: Why did Mariana's dad initially send her to the United States for the senior year of high school?

options.label: A
options.text: To get her away from her friends and family.

options.label: B
options.text: To give her a unique high school experience.

options.label: C
options.text: To help her become a more independent person.

options.label: D
options.text: To give her a chance to experience different cultures and broaden her horizons.

multiple-choice.question: What was the assignment that Mariana received during her first year as a journalist in the United States?

options.label: A
options.text: To cover a local sports event.

options.label: C
options.text: To cover the historic election of President Barack Obama.

options.label: D
options.text: To write a profile on a local business owner.

multiple-choice.question: What was the photo that Mariana took during the 2016 election that had a lasting impact on her?

options.label: A
options.text: A photo of a presidential candidate on the campaign trail.

options.label: B
options.text: A photo of a group of people protesting outside a polling station.

options.label: C
options.text: A photo of an undocumented family, including an eight-year-old girl named Angelina, on election night.

options.label: D
options.text: A photo of Mariana herself voting for the first time.

multiple-choice.question: What did Mariana learn from her experiences as a journalist, particularly during the 2016 election?

options.label: A
options.text: That being a journalist is all about getting the scoop and being the first to report the news.

options.label: B
options.text: That being a journalist requires empathy and understanding of different perspectives.

options.label: C
options.text: That being a journalist is all about being objective and unbiased.

options.label: D
options.text: That being a journalist is a glamorous and exciting career.

multiple-choice.question: What is the main theme of Mariana's story, as told in the transcript?

options.label: A
options.text: The importance of fitting in and being like everyone else.

options.label: B
options.text: The challenges of being different and how to overcome them.

options.label: C
options.text: The power of empathy and understanding in breaking down barriers and embracing our differences.

options.label: D
options.text: The impact of trauma and adversity on individuals and families.

title: When will the next ice age happen? - Lorraine Lisiecki

multiple-choice.question: What term do geologists use to describe the most recent time that ice reached such a huge extent?
Over the last million years, how many different glacial maxima have occurred?
What is the main driver of massive swings in the planet's climate?
What combination of factors causes the wobbles in Earth's axis and its tilt to change?

options.label: D
options.text: Earth's rotation and its movement around the sun, combined with its elliptical orbit

multiple-choice.question: Approximately every 100,000 years, what causes dramatically colder conditions to occur?
What is the expected trend in the Earth's climate over the next few thousand years, based on past climate changes?
What has been rising since the 19th century?
By the end of this century, what is expected to happen to the sea level, due to ice melt?

options.label: C
options.text: It will increase by 30 to 100 centimeters

multiple-choice.question: If a four-degree Celsius warming persisted for several millennia, what is expected to happen to the sea level?

options.label: D
options.text: It will increase by 10 meters or more

multiple-choice.question: What can be done to curb ice loss and save coastal communities?

options.label: D
options.text: Wait for climate change to occur
